argument.name: window_name
argument.description: The name of the window as reported by SYS_ID_ENUM()or seen on the window's title bar.

argument.name: x
argument.description: The new width of the window in inches.

argument.name: y
argument.description: The new height of the window in inches.

page.discussion: SYS_ID_RESIZE() resizes the window named Window_Name to the dimensions specified by Width and Height.

section.title: Example
section.description: The following example assumes that Notepad is open and the name of the window (as seen on the title bar) is "Untitled - Notepad".
section.example: dim ww as N dim wh as N sys_id_show("Untitled - Notepad") ww = valsys_id_size_get("Untitled - Notepad"), 1, "x"? -> get the window width wh = valsys_id_size_get("Untitled - Notepad"), 2, "x"? -> get the window height sys_id_resize("Untitled - Notepad", ww + 1, wh + 1) -> resize the window to 1 inch wider, 1 inch higher
